title: Priti Patel's BBC apology scores a rare victory for common sense in our unstoppable culture war
text:
The Home Secretary was accused of smirking by Andrew Marr

Pity poor Priti. The home secretary’s reputation for being tough on crime to the point of pointlessness has long preceded her, and was bound to make a pantomime villain of her eventually.

Having previously spoken in favour of the death penalty and of wanting to make criminals ‘feel fear,’ to say she can come across as unsympathetic to some would be an understatement. Marry this to the fact that she occupies a great office of state at a time when accusations of "Fascist!" are thrown around with abandon, and it was never likely she would escape demonisation.

But the latest fiasco in which she has found herself embroiled was impressively...
